softwareGame

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • softwareGame.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InterfaceGame

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements InterfaceGame
    Represent a 2-player traditional domino game. With a Stock of Stock.MAXSIZE domino pieces. At the beginning of the game INITIALPIECES are given to each player. The first player that runs out of dominoes win. The player may continue drawing from the stock until it is empty (even if he/ she possess an appropriate domino piece to play). The player may jump only when the stock is empty and does not possess an appropriate domino piece to play. And when looking for the first double domino to put on the table.
    Since:
    2017-03-08
    Version:
    2.1.1
    Author:
    Patricia REINOSO

        public static final int PC_PLAYS_DRAWS
        State of the game. It is the PC's turn. It does not possess an appropriate domino piece to play, so it needs to draw from the stock.

      • INVARIANT

        public static final boolean INVARIANT
        The class invariant checks that the MAXSTATE value is bigger than the MINSTATE value, INITIALPIECES value is appropiate to TOTALPIECES, and that the TOTALPIECES, Table.MAXSIZE, Stock.MAXSIZE and DominoInt.TOTAL are consistent.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • setIndState

        public void setIndState(int val)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        InvariantBrokenException
        Set the state of the game.
        Parameters:
        val - The state of the game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if val is out of bounds MINSTATE .. MAXSTATE.
        InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • receivedMessage

        public void receivedMessage(int val)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                            InvariantBrokenException
        Method called when an event is produced in the graphical interface.
        If val corresponds to GGame.DATA_NAME, the player has inserted his/her name. The game is initialized.
        If val corresponds to GGame.PLAY, the player has clicked on a domino pieces. The event is treated depending on indState.
        If val corresponds to GGame.JUMP, the player has clicked on the Jump button. Check if the event is valid according to indState.
        If val corresponds to GGame.DRAW, the player has clicked on the Draw button.
        if val corresponds to GGame.VALIDPCPLAY, the player has clicked on the Play PC button. Call methods to execute PC actions.
        Other values are considered invalid.
        Specified by:
        receivedMessage in interface InterfaceGame
        Parameters:
        val - indicate the action done by the user player.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if val does not correspond to the events in GGame
        InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.lang.String name)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       InvariantBrokenException
        Set the initial conditions of the game. Create a stock, a board, two players (player and computer), initialize the graphical interface : hand, button and send it the first message.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name is null.
        InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • getEnd

        public int getEnd(int side)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Retrieve a end value of the table object. Use Table.getEndValues(). side is equal to 1 corresponds to the left side of the table. side is equal to 2 corresponds to the right side of the table
        Parameters:
        side - The side to be considered : 1 or 2.
        Returns:
        The extremity value of the domino on the considered side the table. -1 if the table is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if side is not either 1 nor 2.

      • treatDoubleAnswer

        public void treatDoubleAnswer(DominoInt d)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Take the selected domino, verify if can be put on the table. If it is ok, call treatAnswer(DominoInt). Otherwise send a message to the player.
        Parameters:
        d - The selected domino.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the domino is null or not valid.

      • treatAnswer

        public void treatAnswer(DominoInt d)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        InvariantBrokenException
        When a player plays, d is removed from the hand of the player and put on the table. Check if the player wins. Otherwise, call computerDecide().
        Parameters:
        d - The domino selected by the player.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the domino is null or not valid.
        InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • playerDraw

        public void playerDraw()
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                       InvariantBrokenException
        Method called when the player clicks on the Draw button. A domino piece from the stock is given to the player even if he/she possess an appropriate domino piece to play. If the stock is empty, the computer plays. otherwise the drawn domino is added to the hand and wait for the next action of the player. The player may continue drawing from the stock until it is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if state is not PLAYER_PLAYS or PLAYER_PLAYS_EMPTY_STOCK
        InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • computerPlay

        public void computerPlay()
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         InvariantBrokenException
        The computer plays according to the state of the game. If indState is equal to DOUBLE1 , indState is equal to DOUBLE2 , indState is equal to DOUBLE3 , indState is equal to DOUBLE4 , indState is equal to DOUBLE5 , indState is equal to DOUBLE6 we look for a double n on the PC's hand. If the double is found, it is played. Otherwise the PC jump and it is time to find the next double.
        If indState == DOUBLE0 we look for double 0 on the PC's hand. If found, it is played. Otherwise, the PC jump and its the player's turn.
        If indState == PC_PLAYS, the PC has a domino to play. If in fact it can not play, an IllegalStateException is raised. If the PC runs out of dominoes, indicates the winning state.
        If indState == PC_PLAYS_DRAWS, the PC can not play. The PC draws. and tries to play again.
        If indState == PC_BLOCKED, the PC is blocked. It is the player's turn.
        If indState == PC_PLAYS_EMPTY_STOCK, the PC can play a domino. If in fact it can not play, an IllegalStateException is raised. If the PC runs out of dominoes, indicates the winning state.
        Other values for indState are considered illegal states. Set the buttons according to the next expected event.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if state is different from DOUBLE0, DOUBLE1,DOUBLE2,DOUBLE3,DOUBLE4, DOUBLE5,DOUBLE6,PC_PLAYS,PC_PLAYS_DRAWS, PC_BLOCKED, PC_PLAYS_EMPTY_STOCK.
        InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • treatJumpAnswer

        public void treatJumpAnswer()
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Verify that the player does not cheat when clicking on the Jump button. A player can Jump only when he/she does not possess the double searched, Or when he/she does not possess a piece that matches any of the ends of the table and the stock is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if state is different from DOUBLE0, DOUBLE1,DOUBLE2,DOUBLE3,DOUBLE4, DOUBLE5,DOUBLE6,PLAYER_PLAYS, PLAYER_PLAYS_EMPTY_STOCK,PLAYER_PLAYS_PC_BLOCKED.

      • computerDecide

        public void computerDecide()
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                           InvariantBrokenException
        Prepare the game for the PC. Verify if it is possible for the PC to put a domino piece on the table and change the indState properly. Send the appropriate message to the player and ask to click on the Ask the user to click on Play PC button to execute the action.
        Only states DOUBLE0, DOUBLE1,DOUBLE2, DOUBLE3,DOUBLE4, DOUBLE5,DOUBLE6, PLAYER_PLAYS, PC_PLAYS_DRAWS, PLAYER_PLAYS_EMPTY_STOCK, PLAYER_PLAYS_PC_BLOCKED are valid. If the PC can play, let it put the domino piece. Otherwise, its the player turn.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if state is different from DOUBLE0, DOUBLE1,DOUBLE2,DOUBLE3,DOUBLE4, DOUBLE5,DOUBLE6, PLAYER_PLAYS, PC_PLAYS_DRAWS, PLAYER_PLAYS_EMPTY_STOCK, PLAYER_PLAYS_PC_BLOCKED.
        InvariantBrokenException - if the Game state is not valid after execution.

      • setButtons

        public void setButtons(int state)
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Enable the Jump, Draw, Play PC and Hand buttons according to the state. If indState is equal to DOUBLE1 , indState is equal to DOUBLE2 , indState is equal to DOUBLE3 , indState is equal to DOUBLE4 , indState is equal to DOUBLE5 , indState is equal to DOUBLE6 , indState is equal to PLAYER_PLAYS_EMPTY_STOCK or indState is equal to PLAYER_PLAYS_PC_BLOCKED enables only the jump button and clicking the dominoes.Block the rest.
        If indState is equal to PLAYER_PLAYS, enable Draw button and clicking the dominoes. Block the rest.
        If indState is equal to PC_PLAYS_DRAWS, enable Play PC button. Block the rest.
        If indState is equal to -1, block all the buttons. Block the rest.
        Other values for state are considered illegal.
        Parameters:
        state - value to indicate block or enable the appropriate buttons.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if state is not on the values [-1..13].

      • invariant

        public boolean invariant()
        Check that the amount of pieces that are distributed on the stock, the table, and the hands of the players, keeps constant to TOTALPIECES. Check that the stock's and table's invariant are not broken.
        Returns:
        True if the Game is in a valid state. False otherwise.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
